definition: everyone gives their own view
each/every
to express/to give expression to/variant of 紓|纾[shu1]/to relieve
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: From then on, many medical schools and various classics on medicine were brought into being in succession, each having its own strong points.
sentences.chinese: 自此许多不同的学派及经典著作相继出现，各抒己见。

sentences.english: Sound off3. Should people be fined for illegally downloading music?
sentences.chinese: 非法下载歌曲该被罚款吗？来各抒己见吧。

sentences.english: The research group brainstormed the problem all day.
sentences.chinese: 研究小组就此问题整天开展各抒己见的自由讨论。

sentences.english: What a series of questions of setting up etc. to air one's own views.
sentences.chinese: 如何设置等一系列问题各抒己见。

sentences.english: Hope that we can express their opinions together to improve our position.
sentences.chinese: 希望大家能各抒己见，共同提高我们的阵地。

sentences.english: I think it would have been better if you had given us more of a chance to give out opinions.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得如果你要是给我们机会各抒己见就更好了。

definition: lit. fluently saying all one wants (idiom); to preach freely on one's favorite topic/to hold forth to one's heart's content
each sticks to his own opinion (idiom); chacun son gout
each sticks to his own view (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to discuss/to talk over/CL:個|个[ge4]
collecting opinions is of wide benefit (idiom); to pool wisdom for mutual benefit/to profit from widespread suggestions
penetrating insight
opinion/view/understanding
to investigate/to probe
unable to reach a decision (idiom); cannot agree on the right choice/no unanimous decision/still a matter of discussion
discussion
way of looking at a thing/view/opinion/CL:個|个[ge4]
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4

definition: one's own viewpoint
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to argue/to debate/to contend/argument/contention/controversy/debate/CL:次[ci4],場|场[chang3]
war of words
